intro: Pisum sativum var. pumilio, commonly known as the dwarf pea, is a compact variety of the common pea plant. It is characterized by its small stature, typically reaching heights of only 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces small, edible pods that contain round, yellow or green seeds. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and as a space-saving alternative to standard peas. This variety thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
